author: Tyler McLaren
text:
Update:
Convenient that Grailed’s Administration Team assessed my User Feedback on a Grailed “Admin” verified account, and found it to be misleading. 

The number of falsified 5 star submissions on this platform, specifically on “Admin” accounts is misleading. All 5 star reviews without comments have been altered by Admin accounts as the everyday user is required to leave a comment.

Have a quick scan of the “Admin” verified accounts and see how many reviews have no comments.

OP:
After buying and selling thousands of dollars worth of items on Grailed, I recently bought a shirt that was recommended as a "Staff Pick" by Grailed.

I received the item and unfortunately for me,  it was not the size or condition as described in the item description. I contacted the Seller, with no response. Some days later, I contacted the Seller again, Paypal and Grailed. I received an instant response from the Seller acknowledging some "flaws" and a response from Grailed apologising the item was not as described. 

The seller offers me $30 USD (the shirt was purchased for $400 USD). I stated that is not reasonable.

One day later, PayPal closes the case in favour of the seller, and Grailed changes my feedback from 2/5 to 5/5.
Is this not against the purpose of a feedback system? 

Grailed falsely has changed my feedback, which will not warn other buyers of potential issues with this Seller.
title: Grailed "Staff Pick" Flawed Item and False Overwritten Review.

author: NVmd
text:
Awful experience with Grailed. I sold a brand new pair of Golden Goose sneakers (username NVmd). The buyer filed a "claim" immediately after receiving the shipment saying the shoes were not in the box, which was not only a lie, it was a clearly pre-meditated strategy to get the shoes for free. Grailed did not inform me of the buyer's claim, and before I found out about it from PayPal, Grailed had already frozen my account. Grailed never responded to my email inquiry about this, and I wasn't able to speak to anyone because they don't have a phone number. 

Grailed allowed this buyer to literally STEAL a pair of $495 sneakers without providing any proof of what he was claiming! They didn't require him to communicate with me before filing a claim. They didn't inform me of his claim, and froze my account so I couldn't communicate with them once I found out the claim existed. They never gave me a chance to dispute the claim, or even to communicate with the buyer! And even though Paypal overturned their decision to refund the buyer after I gave them the evidence proving the shoes were in the box (photos, tracking info showing the package weight, my long history with eBay and PayPal without any claims like this against me, etc etc), I'm still locked out of Grailed.com. I have no way to communicate with the buyer, and Grailed still hasn't responded to my inquiry. 

Grailed allowed this buyer to commit legal THEFT, and even though PayPal ultimately sided with me, I wish I had the shoes back instead of the money. I'd be happier knowing that fraudulent behavior like this doesn't happen again, and that this despicable buyer learns that Grailed won't protect him like this in the future. Not only to did Grailed allow him to commit fraud and theft, they froze my account without even offering me a chance to respond. It's truly disheartening and terribly disrespectful.

Update: Grailed posted a response to this review below, but they don't even realize that I can't respond here. It's laughably ironic because I tried inquiring to them directly, but they froze my account before I could do that. I sent an email to the general email address they advertise, but didn't get a response there either. 

To "Grailed Team", perhaps you should spend less time freezing accounts and responding to reviews, and more time protecting your users. Also, my Grailed username is listed right in the above review. You must have read this too quickly, just like you froze my account too quickly without having all the relevant details.
title: Awful experience... no protection against fraud!

author: Laura Hawkins
text:
UPDATE:

I have tried to cancel my account by emailing both report@grailedcom and help@grailedcom yet both emails were returned. To minimize any miscommunication I am more than happy to screenshot these returned emails. 

Your response was highly disappointing. Your website is ridiculous when searching for answers with support. This review was not made out of ignorance. I’ve never had so many buyers waste my time with their ability to submit offers with no obligation to pay. I’ve had instances of fraud twice on your website and one where the seller cancelled to relist the item for more. That sends a very bad message to your clientele. The expectations you have set forth to prevent both are minimal in their efficacy. 

It’s interesting you mentioned sellers and buyers are encouraged to communicate because I have had conversations blocked after a seller shared his place of country with me. It was flagged as trying to sell off site yet if you even bothered to read the message, it sure wasn’t. 

Let’s get this straight. It’s not a matter of not spending the time to look through the website for information. Let’s not demean the customer experience. It’s been nothing but issues with this site, multiple times with multiple transactions and I’m not rookie to community selling. 

Picture this...

An eBay-esque site where there’s no seller/buyer protection, no commitment to buy when bidding, no accessible customer service and posting standards that are literally picked blindly out of a hat. See it? Then Grailed is your site! 

As a seller, this site is a joke. They now require you to include pictures of your user name and date in every picture of your item. People can openly bid on your items and then don’t have to commit to buy. It’s a huge waste of time. The commission is ridiculous and shipping is at the cost of the seller in order to funds to be released. Well that sure deters fraud doesn’t it? Take a page from Poshmark or eBay. 

As a buyer, I’ve come across fraud twice and you can only email them. They’re so slow to respond and don’t even monitor their site even though they have ridiculous terms and expectations for postings. There are so many postings that are inactive and sellers that you will never get ahold of. You’ll have more luck gambling in Vegas than hoping the seller will actually respond to you. I have also had sellers cancel the sale and delist for more. Yep, they allow this. 

I have no idea how this site is still around. It’s mission statement appears to be everything you can think to go wrong with a community marketplace. For a 10% commission, it’s great not being able to call you.
title: Picture this...

author: Joseph Walker
text: A buyer approached me to purchase 4 items from my listings. He asked me to ship all 4 items together to save on shipping. He sent me an automated bot answer for Grailed stating that I could add the tracking info under “other” shipping method since Grailed won’t allow you to add the same tracking number to all items ordered by the same buyer, going to the same destination. That method did not work, and was a lie, by Grailed and the buyer. So I tried to contact Grailed numerous times, and they would not talk to me, just kept forwarding bot messages, saying to contact PayPal and add tracking info. They won’t allow me to add tracking info, since all 4 items purchased from the buyer were packaged together and shipped to the same address. Grailed stole my money, and the buyer stole my merchandise. This is straight up theft, and Grailed allows people to scam and steal from sellers. Don’t trust this company. They don’t care about customers, and allows buyers to rip off sellers, by sending misleading bot messages that are entirely false and untrue. You cannot add your tracking number to “other” if it’s the same tracking number for multiple items going to the same seller. I’m contacting the Better Business Bureau regarding this scam operation and theft going on at Grailed.com
title: Grailed Allows Buyers to Steal with Shipping Loopholes

text:
Ticket number 162839

Hi, I have been selling on Grailed for about six months and I have a good 5-star rating. Although I sold a few things, I have good reviews. My nickname is ZhilinDA.

I sold the original Balenciaga sweatshirt and when it arrived, the buyer (Kjartan Nilsen) immediately wrote to me that it was not original, because his friends said so and comments on the Internet on some sites and opened a claim for a paypal.
My account was immediately frozen, I wrote in support of Grailed and they answered ....

«Hi,
Your Grailed account has been frozen for listing counterfeit items. At Grailed, we value the trust and safety of our community and we reserve the right to freeze accounts that are inconsistent with our expectations (grailed com/about/terms). For the safety of the community, we're unable to reinstate your account.»

This is an automatic machine response.

I agreed to return the money to the seller through the dispute on the paypal, but he is still silent and has not sent me the sweatshirt back!

For his part, the Grailed just froze my account and politely sent me to hell! Without any evidence! Please understand this situation and get at least a little protection for sellers, and not just help a buyer who can cheat !!!
